text: Corophium arenarium is a small (up to ) European amphipod crustacean of the family Corophiidae. It looks very similar to C. volutator. It burrows in bottom sediments, between deep. Corophium arenarium originates from the coasts of France and the North Sea. ==External links== * M.J. de Kluijver & S.S. Ingalsuo Corophium arenarium Macrobenthos of the North Sea - Crustacea. Marine Species Identification Portal Category:Corophiidea Category:Crustaceans described in 1937
title: Corophium arenarium
